properties.name: 15 Judkins, Medford
properties.description: Posted by Aaron15 judkins rd, medford, ma

properties.name: 20 Cottage Ave, Winthrop
properties.description: Posted by Aaron20 Cottage Ave, Winthrop, MAGreat location, but the house needed more work than any we\'ve seen, and for that I thought it was ridiculously overpriced. We looked at the place next door last fall: needed work, but not nearly so much - more importantly, it had no parking.

properties.name: 26 Glen Circle, Waltham
properties.description: Posted by Aaron26 Glen Circle, Waltham, MACute place, well-maintained, relative to most of the crap we\'ve looked at. Brian doesn\'t want to live in Waltham. Quiet street, but not the biggest lot. The hideous vinyl siding is sad.

properties.name: 34 East Border Road, Malden
properties.description: Posted by Aaron34 East Border Rd, Malden, MAThis is the place we tried to buy. The inspection was a nightmare: it seemed like everything was wrong, but the most terrifying was the sill rot from the grade being above the sill. And the garden gnome overlooking the cinder-block swimming pool filled with trash was, um, incomparable.

properties.name: 38 Barnes Ave, Malden
properties.description: Posted by Aaron38 Barnes Ave, Malden, MAThis place was big, and in a nice spot. Pricey, and would take a lot of work to make it less hideous. Nothing like a ranch with vinyl siding slapped on to try and make it look like a phony colonial.

properties.name: 66 Wheeler Rd, Stow
properties.description: Posted by Aaron66 Wheeler Road, Stow, MABig deck house in Stow. Great-looking, on a nice lot, but seems to have some potential heating issues - and it\'s way out in Stow.

properties.name: 76 Plummer Ave, Winthrop
properties.description: Posted by Aaron76 Plummer Ave, Winthrop, MAThis one we were actually kind of excited about: it\'s bigger than it looks, and it has a huge unfinished room in the attic with a view of the water. Not much of a yard, though, and it\'s pretty ugly on the outside.

properties.name: 9 Morgan Ave, Medford
properties.description: Posted by Aaron9 Morgan Ave, Medford, MADecent location, but kind of a neighbors-in-your-face area. Nice big house with an odd layout and forced hot air.

properties.name: Amoeba Music (LA)
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 6400 sunset blvd, hollywood, caAdoring hipster throngs, and great vintage electronica

properties.name: Aquitaine
properties.description: Posted by Aaron569 tremont st, boston, maClean, respectable, and polished, with great French food and good wine

properties.name: Audubon Circle
properties.description: Posted by Aaron838 beacon st, boston, maAnother mod lounge space with passable food and good beer

properties.name: B&G Oysters
properties.description: Posted by Aaron550 tremont st, boston, maAnother Barbara Lynch gem, if you can see past the odious South End daddy\'s little rich girl crowd

properties.name: Blue Willow Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 2616 n campbell ave, tucson, azAnother Tucson hippie restaurant; great for brunch, what with their vast omelette selection, they\'ve also got a lot of good sandwiches. Veggie-friendly. Eat in the outside patio; it has misters to keep you cool in summer, and heaters for winter.

properties.name: Bonfire
properties.description: Posted by Aaron50 park plaza, boston, maPricey but good tapas and steak

properties.name: Brasserie Jo
properties.description: Posted by Aaron120 huntington ave, boston, maRelatively inexpensive French food in downtown Boston

properties.name: Bull Moose
properties.description: Posted by Aaron82 congress st, portsmouth, nhGreat new release selection (electronica and whatever) plus fine jazz and folk

properties.name: Carpenter Center for the Visual Arts, Harvard University
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 24 quincy st, cambridge, maLe Corbusier\'s only North American building

properties.name: Central Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Aaron567 massachusetts ave, cambridge, maSolid, often exciting food with, surprisingly, possibly the best wine selection in Boston

properties.name: City Hall, Government Center
properties.description: Posted by Aaronboston, maSoviet-era brutalist gem

properties.name: CityZen
properties.description: Posted by Aaron1330 Maryland Ave SW, Washington, DC5 foodgasms in one meal is a lot of ridiculously rich good eatin. The new restaurant in the Mandarin Oriental stars Eric Ziebold as Chef de Cuisine - but sadly, since we ate there, has lost its mind-blowing pastry chef Jewel (responsible for two of the foodgasms) and her husband Aaron Zimmer, the sous chef, who\'s moved to the Ritz in Half Moon Bay.

properties.name: Cosanti
properties.description: Posted by Aaron6433 E Doubletree Ranch Road, Paradise Valley, AZPaolo Soleri\'s home -- and, uh, wind bell gift shop. This is where Soleri takes apprentices, just as he apprenticed at Frank Lloyd Wright\'s Taliesin West. Fascinating place to walk around.

properties.name: Cushing Street Bar and Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 198 w cushing st, tucson, azGreat little restaurant in the Old Pueblo. Good beer, good food, neat building. Sit outside if it\'s cool enough out.

properties.name: Dante
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 40 Edwin H Land Boulevard, Cambridge, MA

properties.name: Delectables
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 533 N 4th Avenue, Tucson, AZVeggie-friendly and very chill hippie restaurant with good food and friendly service. I went on a date here once and Linda Ronstadt sat down at the table next to me; later a friend worked here as a chef, and said she came in all the time. (That\'s Tucson\'s biggest star-sighting.)

properties.name: Fashion Square Mall
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 7014 E Camelback Rd, Scottsdale, AZOverpriced shopping at its best. (Sadly, AZ has a dire need for the Neiman Marcus here.) Check out Hub Clothing.

properties.name: Food Conspiracy Co-op
properties.description: Posted by Happycow 412 N 4th Ave, Tucson, Arizona, United States, North AmericaVegetarian FriendlyHealth Food StoreReviews

properties.name: Gates Pass
properties.description: Posted by AaronDrive out West on Speedway until it starts meandering; pass any slow drivers; put the top down if you\'ve got a convertible. The route\'s a little scary in the daytime, but the view, night or day, is fantabulous - and once you\'re over the mountains, you\'d never guess Tucson was 20 minutes away.

properties.name: Goodwin's High End
properties.description: Posted by Aaron899 main street, waltham, maUltra-high-end place, carries Linn, Runco, lots of great stuff. Good customer service. Ask for Paul.

properties.name: Gramercy Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Aaron24 marshall st, north adams, maGood service, really nice New American food, and fine wine right next to Mass MoCA

properties.name: Hapa Izakaya
properties.description: Posted by AaronGreat tapas/sushi in Vancouver; get the blow-torched mackerel

properties.name: Historic New England Gropius House
properties.description: Posted by Bdolan200068 Baker Bridge Rd, Lincoln, MA, 01773Historic New England Gropius House 781-259-8098

properties.name: Joe's Record Paradise
properties.description: Posted by Aaron1300 east gude dr, rockville, mdFantastic roots/country/funk/soul selection in a flavorful strip mall area

properties.name: Leonard Zakim Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Aaronboston, maThe new bridge is one of the most notable objects on the Boston skyline, clean and mod and much nicer than the old green iron bridges nearby.

properties.name: Looney Tunes Records
properties.description: Posted by Aaron1001 massachusetts avenue, cambridge, maGreat selection of obscure classical, plus okay R&B

properties.name: Middlesex Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Aaron315 massachusetts ave, cambridge, maMod lounge with decent food, good beer, and polished bamboo walls

properties.name: Mission San Xavier del Bac
properties.description: Posted by Aaron1950 w san xavier rd, tucson, azA 17th Century Spanish mission on the Tohono O\'odham Reservation South of Tucson

properties.name: Mojo Music
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 904 massachusetts ave, cambridge, maRock, vintage, and dance at okay prices

properties.name: Mount Lemmon, Catalina Highway
properties.description: Posted by Aaron  Take Grant East to Tanque Verde, then turn left onto the Catalina Highway, and take it all the way. You\'ll see the saguaros give way to cottonwood-filled riverbeds as you gain altitude (you start at about 2700 feet), then the scrub will get replaced by pine and aspen forest as you approach 8000 feet. Check out the ski lift at the top; at the very peak you can see a couple observatories, and Biosphere 2 off to the North. We caught a horned toad last time. Don\'t ride your brakes on the way down, and look out for insane cyclists.

properties.name: Mystery Train Records
properties.description: Posted by Aaron178 main st, gloucester, maGood country, vintage, and obscure rock selection, plus conservative but solid classical at slightly high prices

properties.name: Natural Sound
properties.description: Posted by Aaron401 worcester road, framingham, maDespite the seedy-looking premises, these guys have great stuff and can set it up pretty well. I\'ve bought a lot of gear from them over the years.

properties.name: Newbury Comics
properties.description: Posted by Aaron211 alewife brook parkway, cambridge, maThe Newbury Comics with the best boston-area vinyl selection. The selection is mostly reissues and brand new releases, but it\'s sometimes rewarding.

properties.name: No. 9 Park
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 9 Park St, boston, ma 02108Near-foodgasmic New American

properties.name: Osushi
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 10 huntington ave, boston, maSome of Boston\'s best sushi, in the Copley Westin complex

properties.name: P1 Kart Circuit
properties.description: Posted by Aaron11800 south harrison rd, tucson, azThe most fun go-karting ever. The track is purportedly a replicea of the Suzuka Kart Circuit in Suzuka, Japan. You can rent karts, or bring your own, and we saw some hard-core shifter-karts buzzing around when we went. Watch out for that decreasing-radius turn (the fourth turn, I think), that caught out two of our team. (But not me! Zroooom!)

properties.name: PDQ Records
properties.description: Posted by Aaron2342 n dodge, tucson, azUnder new ownership, and a temporarily-different name, PDQ has possibly the widest vinyl selection I\'ve ever seen. We bring home a haul every time we go.

properties.name: Parkside
properties.description: Posted by AaronChill atmospher and phenomenal New American locally-grown food in North America\'s utopia

properties.name: Paul Bunyan the Axe Murderer
properties.description: Posted by AaronStone and Glen, Tucson, AZGiant statue of crazed-looking Paul Bunyan in Tucson. This is one of many roadside eccentricities scattered throughout the city.

properties.name: Pima Air and Space Museum
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 6000 E Valencia Rd, Tucson, AZForget the Space part, but this is a great cold war airplane graveyard. They\'ve got B52s, SR71s, Migs, WW2 German pulsejets... I found it extremely disturbing, in a flashing-back-to-Ronnie-Reagan-about-to-cause-the-world-to-end kind of way, but it\'s worth checking out. You can get a tour of the boneyard (the "AMARC") at the Davis Monthan Air Force Base, which I highly recommend.

properties.name: Reddington Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Aaron  Take Grant to East Tanque Verde, and keep on going, past where it switches over to dirt, past the cattle guards, then up about half a mile. Park, and follow the trails on the South down into the canyon. You\'ll encounter a surprising number of naked (and possibly aroused) men (and the occasional woman), but hike upstream up the canyon, and you\'ll be rewarded with otherworldly scenery. Usually, in Springtime, there\'s chilly flowing water carrying snowmelt. You might see the occasional free-range cow, too.

properties.name: Round Again Records
properties.description: Posted by Aaron278 wickenden st, providence, riGreat little selection of mostly vintage rock and jazz -- Peggy Lee, Sinatra, Louis Armstrong. They even sell record players!

properties.name: Rustic Kitchen, Porter Square
properties.description: Posted by Aaron1815 massachusetts ave, cambridge, maSolid tapas and pasta with a great wine list, as long as you ignore the staff recommendations

properties.name: Sakura Systems
properties.description: Posted by Aaron2 Rocky Mountain Road, Jefferson, MAYoshi Segoshi runs a hi-fi distribution business out of his home. He\'s a trip, and a fantastic guy. He sells great amplifiers, speakers, cable kits, CD players, and phono cartridges from 47 Labs.

properties.name: Spire
properties.description: Posted by Aaron90 tremont st, boston, ma 02108Solid New American in a great space

properties.name: Stereo Jack's
properties.description: Posted by Aaron1686 massachusetts ave, cambridge, maLots of jazz, plus standards, rock, and folk, at generally great prices

properties.name: Sugar and Spice
properties.description: Posted by Aaron1933 massachusetts ave, cambridge, maInexpensive and fine Thai food in Porter Square

properties.name: Taliesin West
properties.description: Posted by Aaronscottsdale, azFrank Lloyd Wright\'s school in Arizona

properties.name: The Butcher Shop
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 552 tremont st, boston, maShockingly competent wine recommendations and solid European carnivore food

properties.name: The Rendezvous
properties.description: Posted by Aaron509 mass ave, cambridge, maThe ghost of Burger Kings past haunts this unfortunate, unexciting, and overpriced disappointment

properties.name: Time Market
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 444 E University Blvd, Tucson, AZDeli and market, with a great beer selection, fresh bread, some produce, etc. Good sandwiches and flakey staff. They sell Scharffenberger chocolate.

properties.name: Titan 2 Missile Museum
properties.description: Posted by Aaron This was much better than the Air and Space Museum; here you\'ll see a decommissioned Titan 2 missile in its silo, which you can tour, with guides who understand exactly how scary this stuff was. Learn about the Titan that exploded!

properties.name: Titan Missile Museum
properties.description: Posted by Aaron  green valley, az

properties.name: Tucson Botanical Garden
properties.description: Posted by Aaron2150 n alvernon way, tucson, azNeat little garden with a lot of native and imported xericulture exhibits; this isn\'t all roses and lush east-coast plants watered into submission in the desert, it\'s breathtakingly beautiful desert plants, shrubs, trees, and cacti, along with some exhibits of First Peoples agriculture.

properties.name: Twisted Village
properties.description: Posted by Aaron12 eliot st, cambridge, maOur best source for obscure punk, electronica, modernist classical, and prog.

properties.name: Upstairs on the Square
properties.description: Posted by Aaron 91 Winthrop St, Cambridge, MAAcid-trip decor meets fine food, good service, and fascinating conversations.

properties.name: Vinny's at Night
properties.description: Posted by Aaron76 Broadway, Somerville, MASicilian-grandmother-style Italian in the basement of a convenience store in an extra-skanky part of the \'ville. What could be better?

properties.name: Where the kitties grew up
properties.description: Posted by Aaron155 n cherry ave, tucson, az
